thread.title: Tory procured young men with the Krays
thread.title_full: Tory procured young men with the Krays

title: Tory procured young men with the Krays
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Tory procured young men with the Krays Robert Boothby, left, with Ronnie Kray, was a concern to the home secretary Channel 4 David Sanderson Published at 12:01AM, October 23 2015 
It would have been the most explosive scandal of the 1960s — a senior Tory’s relationship with the Kray twins, his procurement of young men for sex, and his affair with the prime minister’s wife. If it had been made public, ministers feared it would have been more embarrassing than the Profumo affair. 
Newly disclosed MI5 files have finally shed light on the government’s concerns over the antics of Robert Boothby, a bisexual peer who befriended the Krays and went “hunting” for young men with them. 
It can be revealed that Henry Brooke, the Tory home secretary in 1964, summoned Roger Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
